Class InstanceReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sat4j.reader.Reader
      • org.sat4j.reader.InstanceReader
  • public class InstanceReader
extends Reader
    An reader having the responsibility to choose the right reader according to the input.

    leberre

      • parseInstance

        public IProblem parseInstance​(String filename)
                       throws ParseFormatException,
                              IOException,
                              ContradictionException
        Description copied from class: Reader
        This is the usual method to feed a solver with a benchmark.
        Overrides:
        parseInstance in class Reader
        Parameters:
        filename - the fully qualified name of the benchmark. The filename extension may by used to detect which type of benchmarks it is (SAT, OPB, MAXSAT, etc).
        Returns:
        the problem to solve (an ISolver in fact).
        Throws:
        ParseFormatException - if an error occurs during parsing.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        ContradictionException - if the problem is found trivially inconsistent.

      • handleFileName

        protected Reader handleFileName​(String fname,

      • decode

        @Deprecated
public String decode​(int[] model)
        Deprecated.
        Description copied from class: Reader
        Produce a model using the reader format. Note that the approach of building a string representation of the model may be quite inefficient when the model is rather large. For that reason, the preferred way to proceed is to directly output the textual representation in a specific PrintWriter using Reader.decode(int[], PrintWriter)
        Specified by:
        decode in class Reader
        Parameters:
        model - a model using the Dimacs format.
        Returns:
        a human readable view of the model.
        See Also:
        Reader.decode(int[], PrintWriter)

      • decode

        public void decode​(int[] model,
                   PrintWriter out)
        Description copied from class: Reader
        Produce a model using the reader format on a provided printwriter.
        Specified by:
        decode in class Reader
        Parameters:
        model - a model using the Dimacs format.
        out - the place where to display the model

      • parseInstance

        public IProblem parseInstance​(InputStream in)
                       throws ParseFormatException,
                              ContradictionException,
                              IOException
        Description copied from class: Reader
        Read a file from a stream. It is important to note that benchmarks are usually encoded in ASCII, not UTF8. As such, the only reasonable way to feed a solver from a stream is to use a stream.
        Specified by:
        parseInstance in class Reader
        Parameters:
        in - a stream containing the benchmark.
        Returns:
        the problem to solve (an ISolver in fact).
        Throws:
        ParseFormatException - if an error occurs during parsing.
        ContradictionException - if the problem is found trivially inconsistent.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • hasAMapping

        Description copied from class: Reader
        Does the reader found a mapping.
        Overrides:
        hasAMapping in class Reader
        Returns:
        true iff the solver found a mapping in the problem
